author: Amanda M
title: A great 6 night stay in New York -
text:
The hotel is wonderfully situated just a stone's throw from Time Square which makes it a most central place from which to explore New York.
The hotel staff are all very friendly and helpful - they made us feel completely at home.
We didn't use the restaurant as we had paid for a room only and wanted to explore different places for all our meals. Therefore we sadly cannot comment on the hotel restaurant.
The hotel has a pool which is tiny. It's great for people just chilling/socialising and obviously is great for kids. It is located near the hotel bar so people congregate there as part of their evening 'wind down'. However, if you are a swimmer - forget it! (Thanks to a helpful member of the hotel staff, I found a larger swimming pool in a nearby hotel).
Our room was small and quite dark but our bed was insanely comfortable! The bathroom was tiny but had a good shower. Aircon and heating worked well.
We had a really wonderful stay in New York and we really enjoyed the hotel.
One word of advice when you arrive at JFK, make sure you don't get fleeced by unscrupulous taxi drivers - the fee should only be around $75 to the hotel, so be sure to ask before you accept a ride!
